contact.title: Contact the U.S. Access Board

usagov.description: The Access Board is an independent federal agency devoted to accessibility for people with disabilities. The Board develops and maintains design criteria for the built environment, transit vehicles, telecommunications equipment, and for electronic and information technology.

contact.title: Contact the U.S. AbilityOne Commission

usagov.description: The AbilityOne Commission creates job opportunities for people who are blind or have other significant disabilities in the manufacture and delivery of products and services to the Federal Government.
usagov.name: AbilityOne Commission

forms.title: U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) Forms

contact.title: Contact the African Development Foundation

contact.title: Contact the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts

usagov.name: Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts

contact.title: Contact the Administrative Conference of the United States

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Arctic Research Commission

usagov.description: The U.S. Arctic Research Commission develops and recommends a national Arctic research policy.
usagov.name: Arctic Research Commission

contact.title: Contact the Appalachian Regional Commission

usagov.description: The Appalachian Regional Commission works for sustainable community and economic development in Appalachia.
usagov.name: Appalachian Regional Commission

contact.title: Contact the National Railroad Passenger Corporation (AMTRAK)

usagov.description: Amtrak, the National Railroad Passenger Corporation, provides intercity rail passenger service.

contact.title: Contact AmeriCorps

usagov.name: AmeriCorps

contact.title: Contact AmeriCorps Seniors
Find a Volunteer Opportunity Near You

usagov.description: AmeriCorps Seniors is a network of volunteer programs for Americans 55 years and older. Volunteers work in their community doing academic tutoring and mentoring, elderly care, disaster relief, and more.
usagov.name: AmeriCorps Seniors

contact.title: Contact the American Battle Monuments Commission
Order Floral Decorations for Grave Sites

local_offices.title: Search for Individuals Buried or Memorialized Overseas

usagov.description: The American Battle Monuments Commission manages 24 overseas military cemeteries, and 25 memorials, monuments, and markers. Nearly all the cemeteries and memorials honor those who served in World War I or World War II.
usagov.name: American Battle Monuments Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Bureau o.name: [usagov] Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection (Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection)

contact.title: Contact the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
Submit a Complaint

usagov.description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau helps consumers by providing educational materials and accepting complaints. It supervises banks, lenders, and large non-bank entities, such as credit reporting agencies and debt collection companies. The Bureau also works to make credit card, mortgage, and other loan disclosures clearer, so consumers can understand their rights and responsibilities.
usagov.name: Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Barry M..name: [usagov] Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program (Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program)

usagov.name: Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program

contact.title: Contact the Bankruptcy Courts

local_offices.title: Find Bankruptcy Courts Offices Near You

usagov.description: Each of the 94 federal judicial districts  handles bankruptcy matters, and in almost all districts, bankruptcy cases are filed in the bankruptcy court. Bankruptcy laws help people who can no longer pay their creditors get a fresh start by liquidating their assets to pay their debts, or by creating a repayment plan.
usagov.name: Bankruptcy Courts

usagov.name: Chief Financial Officers Council

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Chief Ac.name: [usagov] Chief Acquisition Officers Council (Chief Acquisition Officers Council)

usagov.description: The Chief Acquisition Officers Council monitors and improves the federal acquisition system.
usagov.name: Chief Acquisition Officers Council

contact.title: Contact the Chemical Safety Board

usagov.description: The Chemical Safety Board investigates industrial chemical accidents.
usagov.name: Chemical Safety Board

contact.title: Contact the Central Intelligence Agency

usagov.name: Central Intelligence Agency (CIA)

contact.title: Contact the Consumer Product Safety Commission
Report an Unsafe Product

usagov.description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) protects the public from unreasonable risks of serious injury or death from thousands of types of consumer products under its jurisdiction, including products that pose a fire, electrical, chemical, or mechanical hazard or can injure children.
usagov.name: Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC)

website.title: Officers and Staff of the Senate

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Senate

usagov.description: The U.S. Senate and the U.S. House of Representatives make up the two chambers of Congress.  The Senate has 100 members, 2 from each state, who are elected to serve for a term of 6 years.
usagov.name: Congress—U.S. Senate

contact.title: Contact the U.S. House of Representatives

usagov.name: Congress—U.S. House of Representatives

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Commodit.name: [usagov] Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) (Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC))

contact.title: Contact the Commodity Futures Trading Commission

usagov.description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission protects the public from fraud, manipulation, and abusive practices related to the sale of commodity and financial futures and options, and to fosters open, competitive, and financially sound futures and option markets. They investigate and prosecute commodities fraud, including foreign currency schemes, energy manipulation and hedge fund fraud, and works with other federal and state agencies to bring criminal and other actions.
usagov.name: Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC)

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom

usagov.name: Commission on International Religious Freedom

usagov.description: The U.S. Courts of Appeal hear appeals from lower courts of both civil and criminal trials, but do not investigate the facts of a case. Rather, the Appeals Courts investigate whether or not the law has been fairly and correctly applied by the lower courts.
usagov.name: Circuit Courts of Appeal

contact.title: Contact the Denali Commission
Staff Directory

usagov.description: The Denali Commission provides critical utilities, infrastructure, and economic support throughout Alaska.
usagov.name: Denali Commission

contact.title: Contact the Delta Regional Authority

usagov.description: The Delta Regional Authority is a partnership to improve economic and community growth in eight states. Those states are Alabama, Arkansas, Illinois, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, and Tennessee.
usagov.name: Delta Regional Authority

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Delaware.name: [usagov] Delaware River Basin Commission (Delaware River Basin Commission)

contact.title: Contact the Delaware River Basin Commission
Staff Directory

usagov.description: In 1961, the federal government and the governments of Delaware, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and New York, entered into an agreement that created the Delaware River Basin Commission. The Commission has the independent legal authority to oversee and manage the Delaware River Basin.
usagov.name: Delaware River Basin Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Equal Em.name: [usagov] Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) (Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC))

contact.title: Contact the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission

usagov.description: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) enforces laws that make discrimination illegal in the workplace. The commission oversees all types of work situations including hiring, firing, promotions, harassment, training, wages, and benefits.
usagov.name: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC)

contact.title: Contact the Environmental Protection Agency

usagov.description: The Environmental Protection Agency protects people and the environment from significant health risks, sponsors and conducts research, and develops and enforces environmental regulations.
usagov.name: Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)

contact.title: Contact the Election Assistance Commission

usagov.description: The Election Assistance Commission (EAC) supports state and local election officials in their efforts to ensure accessible, accurate. and secure elections. EAC develops guidance to meet the Help America Vote Act requirements, adopts voluntary voting system guidelines, and serves as a national clearinghouse of information on election administration. EAC also accredits testing laboratories and certifies voting systems, as well as audits the use of Help America Vote Act funds.
usagov.name: Election Assistance Commission (EAC)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Economic.name: [usagov] Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment (Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment)

website.title: Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment

contact.title: Contact Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment

usagov.description: The Under Secretary of State for Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment leads the State Department’s efforts to develop and implement international policies related to economic growth, energy, agriculture, the ocean, the environment, and science and technology.
usagov.name: Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Export-I.name: [usagov] Export-Import Bank of the United States (Export-Import Bank of the United States)

website.title: Export-Import Bank of the United States

contact.title: Contact the Export-Import Bank of the United States

usagov.description: The Export-Import Bank assists American businesses export their goods by providing financial assistance in the form of loans, loan guarantees and insurance. The focus of the Export-Import Bank is on assisting small businesses.
usagov.name: Export-Import Bank of the United States

usagov.name: Federal Election Commission

usagov.description: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) answers questions about federal deposit insurance coverage, and handles complaints and inquiries about FDIC-insured state banks which are not members of the Federal Reserve System.
usagov.name: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] Federal.name: [usagov] Federal Communications Commission (FCC) (Federal Communications Commission (FCC))

contact.title: Contact the Federal Communications Commission
File a Complaint with the Federal Communications Commission

usagov.name: Federal Communications Commission (FCC)

contact.title: Contact the Farm Credit Administration

usagov.description: The Farm Credit Administration is an independent financial regulatory agency that oversees the Farm Credit System, a nationwide network of lending institutions that serve farmers, ranchers, agricultural cooperatives, and other eligible borrowers. It also oversees the Federal Agricultural Mortgage Corporation or Farmer Mac, which provides a secondary market for agricultural real estate mortgage loans, rural housing loans, and rural cooperative loans.
usagov.name: Farm Credit Administration

usagov.name: Federal Trade Commission (FTC)

usagov.description: The Department of the Treasury manages Federal finances by collecting taxes and paying bills and by managing currency, government accounts and public debt. The Department of the Treasury also enforces finance and tax laws.
usagov.name: Department of the Treasury

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] White Ho.name: [usagov] Department of the Interior (DOI) (Department of the Interior (DOI))

contact.title: Contact the Department of the Interior

usagov.description: The Department of the Interior manages public lands and minerals, national parks, and wildlife refuges and upholds Federal trust responsibilities to Indian tribes and Native Alaskans. Additionally, Interior is responsible for endangered species conservation and other environmental conservation efforts.
usagov.name: Department of the Interior (DOI)

usagov.description: The Department of State advises the President and leads the nation in foreign policy issues. The State Department negotiates treaties and agreements with foreign entities, and represents the United States at the United Nations.
usagov.name: Department of State (DOS)

local_offices.title: Department of Labor Wage and Hour Division Local Offices

usagov.description: The Department of Labor administers federal labor laws to guarantee workers' rights to fair, safe, and healthy working conditions, including minimum hourly wage and overtime pay, protection against employment discrimination, and unemployment insurance.
usagov.name: Department of Labor (DOL)

contact.title: Contact the Department of Justice
Directory of Department Officials

usagov.description: The Department of Justice enforces federal laws, seeks just punishment for the guilty, and ensures the fair and impartial administration of justice.
usagov.name: Department of Justice (DOJ)

usagov.description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development administers programs that provide housing and community development assistance. The Department also works to ensure fair and equal housing opportunity for all.
usagov.name: Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usagov] White Ho.name: [usagov] Department of Homeland Security (DHS) (Department of Homeland Security (DHS))

contact.title: Contact the Department of Homeland Security

usagov.description: The Department of Homeland Security works to improve the security of the United States. The Department's work includes customs, border, and immigration enforcement, emergency response to natural and manmade disasters, antiterrorism work, and cybersecurity.
usagov.name: Department of Homeland Security (DHS)

usagov.description: The Department of Health and Human Services protects the health of all Americans and provides essential human services.
usagov.name: Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)

contact.title: Contact the Department of Energy

usagov.description: The Department of Energy manages the United States' nuclear infrastructure and administers the country's energy policy. The Department of Energy also funds scientific research in the field.
usagov.name: Department of Energy (DOE)

contact.title: Contact the Department of Education
Student Loan Questions

usagov.description: The Department of Education fosters educational excellence, and to ensures equal access to educational opportunity for all.
usagov.name: Department of Education (ED)

contact.title: Contact the National Security Council

usagov.description: The National Security Council advises the President on national security and foreign policy.
usagov.name: National Security Council (NSC)

usagov.description: The Office of Management and Budget oversees the performance of federal agencies, and administers the federal budget.
